job_title: Housing Operations Specialist  in Jacksonville, AL
pros: I loved working here. It really is the “friendliest campus in the south”. The people are great, the benefits are great, and the work-life balance is great
cons: The pay isn’t the best because it’s a government job, but it’s overall a great place to work.

pros: Amazing work environment People really do like and support each other They invest in you as a person and professional
cons: I cannot think of any downside

pros: Great place to develop your skills and grow as a professional.
cons: If you are not familiar with the area, Jacksonville is located in a small town an hour away from Birmingham. If you are looking for busier places this might not be the right place.

pros: Flexible hours and worked well with others
cons: Management needs some improvement from the years there

pros: Ability to Teach while taking classes!
cons: None at all! do it!

pros: Great experience for new coaches
cons: Administration can be a bit slow

review_title: Not as immersive as I thought
pros: - Get to come in contact with new technologies
cons: - Not as immersive into the technology as I would have liked in 4 years

job_title: Graduate Administrative Assistant in Jacksonville, AL
pros: Working for the university in exchange for tuition was a great opportunity for me. As a GA I worked up to 20 hours each week and received a stipend of $480 each month and the University covered tuition and fees for up to three classes each semester.
cons: Job details weren't always super clear and communication was spotty.

job_title: Assistant Director of Technical Operations in Jacksonville, AL
pros: Positive work environment; relatively low stress job; quality insurance
cons: Silos can make collaboration between some departments difficult; limited options for upward mobility and financial growth

pros: Great coworkers, positive environment, great students
cons: Can’t really think of any other than dealing with higher administration

job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in Jacksonville, AL
pros: Boosted my resume, gave me experience with data analytics prior to grad school, and enables me to be on a publication before even graduating.
cons: I experienced no downsides to this job, but it did require a lot of self-supervision and discipline. It worked for me, but I think some people would feel move comfortable with more oversight.

job_title: Campus Tour Guide in Jacksonville, AL
pros: You get to walk around the campus
cons: Pay is low to make a living

pros: Small size, friendly, beautiful location in the Southern Appalachian Mountains of northern Alabama, regional university that is growing, and a department that is growing. Opportunities for internal funding. Research and teaching important in sciences. Great support from Faculty Commons and Office of Sponsored Programs. Student Success center and extra tutoring opportunities for students.
cons: Student quality is declining, many/most students live off campus and work a job, heavy teaching load, and no startup for entering science professors (although departments can use funds ad lib for small equipment purchases).

pros: beneifits of refunds, free housing and food
cons: is very stressful and not worth the money

pros:
- Personal office space
- Network with faculty
- Resume Builder
- Flexible work hours
- Study in free time
cons: The only con I can think of is the fact it is a minimum wage job. Unless you have some other form of financial support, this position is definelty not a proper source of income. Purely for a student in need of some flexibility.

review_title: Pay is minimum wage. Higher wage is needed.
job_title: Front Desk Assistant in Jacksonville, AL
pros:
Nice People. Sweet Home Alabama.
Jobs like these help students to make $ while in school.
cons: Pay is min. wage. Other than that everything else was good, solemn and rock steady. If you are in Alabama, try boiled pickled egg.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Jacksonville, AL
pros:
Excellent faculty who were able to communicate effectively.
Reasonable hours.
Rewarding experience.
cons: I would have liked to have more latitude in how the class was structured, but I understand the reason why that was not the case.

pros:
Several new building is being built on campus, 
have a good work-life balance
small classes
cons:
fewer labs for some courses
students may need to work to support themselves while studying at school

job_title: Financial Aid Counselor in Jacksonville, AL
pros: Great Benefits and Tuition Assistance.
cons: I liked working at Jacksonville State.

pros: Good benefits, including time off
cons: Long hours. Early mornings, late nights, some traveling

pros: Full time experience running a video department
cons: Work life balance can be difficult

pros: Great work environment, many opportunities to grow and learn.
cons: No cons, its a great place to work.

pros: It was good and fun
cons: On call is sometimes annoying but not reaaly bad

pros: everyone there very friendly and will most likely help you
cons: they don't hire their student workers

job_title: Computer Science Tutor in Jacksonville, AL
pros: Practice with your major, practice working with people and explaining difficult concepts in a simple manor, great college job if you're just trying to get by.
cons: Low salary, no benefits, restricted to 20 hours a week.

pros: Beautiful rural setting for a college town
cons: Far from metropolitan cities in area

pros: Good hours, great atmosphere, flexible
cons: Not high paying but that’s expected

pros: Flexible, convenient, great, comfortable atmosphere
cons: Have to tailor schedule to classes

pros: Learned a lot and had fun
cons: Parking is limited, books cost too much

pros: Overall my experience as a graduate assistant at the MCIS department of JSU has been positive. I have had experience with teaching my own freshman course, which has made me more confident in public speaking and gave me the opportunity to design projects for students. The instructors and professors of the department are very enthusiastic and always have interesting research and projects to work on.
cons: The tuition remission does not cover the online fee of courses, and all courses in the computer science graduate program are online.

review_title: I loved being a Graduate Teaching Assistant!! The people are great!!
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Jacksonville, AL
pros:
Great people
Good environment 
Everyone is helpful and welcoming no matter what is going on there is someone there either other GTA or professor to help you out. 
Classes being payed for as part of the pay for graduate students who become GTA's.
cons:
At the time the pay was low for the work (but I heard there was a pay raise) 
Sometimes there wasn't enough equipment for all experiments, or the equipment was old or in need of repair.

review_title: Graduate Administrative Assistant - School of Education
job_title: Graduate Administrative Assistant in Jacksonville, AL
pros: Most amazing graduate assistant job one can have. I love my co workers and the work environment. Everyone is so passionate and loves what that they do. The energy is contagious and I am glad to be a part of the team. They work with you schedule and it compliments my coursework load well; working as a graduate assistant has never interfered with with my coursework.
cons: There are no cons so far.

review_title: Great experience right out of college but no room for growth unless you switch jobs within the institution.
pros: The best medical in the state. Same paid vacation time as students (spring break, thanksgiving, christmas, etc.) Great first job.
cons: No room for growth. A lot of office politics. Hard to get in if you don't know someone already.

pros: Good first job / work place experience. Hands on approach. New challenges every day. Professors and students are easy to assist. No complications.
cons: Minimum wage. As a student-worker you are not allowed to work over 20 hours even if you need the job. Which is fair, considering there are other students, and more importantly, you are a student first before a worker.

pros: Free housing comes with the job.  In addition, you get a monthly paycheck.  You save over $2000 by getting a free room each semester.
cons: You have to work on their schedule.  Additionally, the pay sucks.  It is not even enough to live off of as a college student.

review_title: Tutoring is a good part time job for students but the monthly pay is a real drag
pros:
Flexible hours
Looks good on a resume
Relatively quiet
Convenient computer lab
cons:
Monthly pay 15 days after the month ends
Max 20 hours weekly
Minimum wage
Having to deal with athletes who don’t want to be there but are forced to come. They act like children.

pros:
Pros:  Cooperative environment for employees
            Good retirement benefits
            Emphasis on good teaching v. research
cons: Remote location with limited options

pros: The staff is very helpful. You are fully trained at your position so that you know what to do and how to do your job.
cons: I only worked at the library so I cannot speak for the entire university as a whole. The library was great.

job_title: Financial Aid Assistant in Boaz, AL
pros: This job requires a lot of analytical thinking, problem solving, and is very flexible with the hours.
cons: There is many government laws to learn. Have to stay updated on the laws frequently.  This is job can be stressful.

pros: Friendly, and helpful faculty and staff. Great learning opportunity as a student working there, it also allowed me to make some money.
cons: Only minimum wage can be offered to students working in student positions.

pros: Engaged employer/easy to get constructive feedback, administration willing to go the extra mile for employees
cons: very mission oriented and with that perhaps a more narrow focus on some of the higher-ed objectives.

review_title: a good environment to work while perusing a degree
pros: flexible hours, better pay than fast food
cons: there's not really, it's an on-campus job in a small town

pros: Always very communicative, great work environment, fair pay
cons: Occasional lack of clarity on goals and responsibilities

pros:
Work-Life Balance
Training program
Leadership opportunities
Management
Independence (Not much oversight)
cons:
Compensation (Minimum Wage)
Few hours of work (20 max)

pros: Excellent to schedule to handle school work
cons: No serious problems at this time

pros: Good benefits and friendly atmosphere
cons: No room to advance and minimal raises

pros: OK place to work at
cons: Not enough hours given to work

job_title: Professor of History in Jacksonville, AL
pros: Until recently, the administration left the faculty alone.  This, however is changing.
cons: All anyone cares about is football.  There is absolutely no interest in anything academic or intellectual.
